DOC.brief_summary: The primary aim clinical trial compare treatment success two minimally invasive surgical procedure treat stress urinary incontinence woman . These procedure call mid-urethral sling . The secondary aim trial compare outcomes two surgical procedure , include quality life , sexual function , satisfaction treatment outcome , complication , need treatment ( ) surgery . Follow-up minimum two year .
DOC.criteria: Female Stress urinary incontinence ( SUI ) evidence follow : Selfreported stresstype urinary incontinence symptom , duration ≥ 3 month Medical , Epidemiological Social Aspects Aging ( MESA ) stress symptom score ( percent total possible stress score ) great MESA urge symptom score ( percent total possible urge score ) Observation leakage provocative stress test bladder volume ≤ 300ml Bladder capacity ≥ 200ml stress test Postvoid residual ( PVR ) ≤ 100cc pelvic organ prolapse ( POP ) Stage I low . If POP Stage IIIV , PVR > 100cc ≤ 500cc allow Eligible retropubic transobturator procedures No medical contraindication , e.g. , current urinary tract infection ( UTI ) , history pelvic irradiation , history lower urinary tract cancer American Society Anesthesiologists ( ASA ) class I , II , III No current intermittent catheterization Available 24months followup able complete study assessment , per clinician judgment Signed consent form Age < 21 year Nonambulatory ( ambulatory assistive device exclude patient ) Pregnancy selfreport positive pregnancy test , selfreported intention ever become pregnant Current chemotherapy current history pelvic radiation therapy Systemic disease know affect bladder function ( i.e. , Parkinson 's disease , multiple sclerosis , spina bifida , spinal cord injury trauma ) Urethral diverticulum , current previous ( i.e . repair ) Prior augmentation cystoplasty artificial sphincter Implanted nerve stimulators urinary symptom History synthetic sling stress urinary incontinence < 12 month postpartum Laparoscopic open pelvic surgery < 3 months* Current evaluation treatment chronic pelvic pain ( painful bladder syndrome ) Participation another treatment intervention trial might influence result trial Need concomitant surgery require abdominal incision , use graft material anterior compartment , use synthetic graft material Enrollment urinary incontinence trial include SISTEr/ESISTEr BEDRI/EBEDRI
